meanings.definition: To treat with indifference or neglect
meanings.sent1: He would slight his chores and play instead.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to slight her friend's feelings.
meanings.sent3: The cat would slight the new toy in favor of the old one.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would never slight any student's efforts.
meanings.sent5: They would slight the warnings and venture into the forest.
